summary: This bill, the Bottles and Breastfeeding Equipment Screening Enhancement Act, mandates that the Transportation Security Administration (TSA) and private security companies maintain hygienic standards when screening breast milk, baby formula, purified water, and juice during aviation security screenings. It requires the TSA to issue or update hygiene guidance, developed in consultation with maternal health organizations, to minimize contamination risks. The bill also mandates an Inspector General audit to assess compliance and report on the impact of screening technologies and entry denial rates for these items.
